thread.title: Shoe selfies: dangling limb shots above New York
thread.title_full: Shoe selfies: dangling limb shots above New York

author: Hugh Morris
title: Shoe selfies: dangling limb shots above New York
text:
Comments 
A helicopter company that straps its guests in, opens the doors and allows them to behave like extreme aerial photographers above two of the world’s greatest cities, has spawned a new phenomenon in the form of the dangling shoe selfie. 
Amateur paps who book a trip with FlyNYON are able to direct their pilot around the skies above either New York or Miami, while doing their best to take dramatic shots of the city below. 
And though the likes of the Empire State Building, Central Park or South Beach feature heavily in the post-flight photo albums, it’s their footwear that takes centre stage. A photo posted by FlyNYON (@flynyon) on Aug 8, 2015 at 12:59pm PDT 
A quick scan of social media will tell you that the shoe selfie is no new thing - Twitter and Instagram users have long been taking photos of their feet for their feed. But never have their appendages looked so remarkable. 
To dangle your feet off the side off the chopper and steady your hands to take a photo certainly requires nerves of steel, as the ground beckons beneath you and the blades thunder above. 
• 10 most popular places to take a selfie 
FlyNYON’s website says the flights are the “ultimate aerial photo experience”. It says: “Be like the pros and harness into our helicopter with open doors, giving you visual access to the world below. 
“Use your creative eye to capture the images that inspire you and challenge your photographic skills. Don’t be fooled, it is not as easy as it looks, but it sure is fun and will encourage you to come back for more.” 
The site says the trip will not go ahead if the weather is so poor that they are unable to fly or take pictures, however, “some of the best images come when the weather is not perfectly clear”.
